name: 9,10-dihydrobenzo[a]pyrene-7(8h)-one
Reason: The compound 9,10-dihydrobenzo[a]pyrene-7(8h)-one includes several structural features that influence its melting point. The basic unit is benzo[a]pyrene which has a high melting point due to its polycyclic aromatic structure providing a large surface area for π-π interactions, contributing to a higher melting point around 179 °C for benzo[a]pyrene. The dihydro addition (two extra hydrogens) slightly reduces the planarity and the π-π interactions, leading to a decrease, estimated here as -10 °C. The ketone group also influences the melting point by introducing a polar functional group that can engage in dipole-dipole interactions, typically increasing the melting point. However, the influence of the ketone in this molecule is moderated by its location within the hydrophobic carbon framework, so the increase is estimated at +5 °C. The overall predicted melting point is a balance of these effects.
